alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tuscaloosa County through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bankhead Lock And Dam, or 11 miles northeast of Holt, moving southeast at 5 mph. Additional clusters of storms were also developing across central Tuscaloosa County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holt, Lake View, Brookwood, Vance, Abernant, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Mercedes Benz Of Alabama, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Binion Creek Landing, Lake Tuscaloosa, Lake Tuscaloosa Dam, Fleetwood, East Brookwood, Sexton Bend, Peterson, Lake Harris, Tierce Pattton Bridge, Lake Nicol, Highway 69 Bridge and I 20 Rest Area Near Tuscaloosa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
